alert.note: Alert for Northwest Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 29 at 4:32AM EST until January 30 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Maryland... Virginia... Potomac River at Point of Rocks affecting Frederick MD and Western Loudoun zones. Potomac River at Edwards Ferry affecting Eastern Loudoun, Western Loudoun and Northwest Montgomery zones. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls... flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Potomac River at Edwards Ferry. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Water reaches the boat ramp and lower parking area at Edwards Ferry, and begins to inundate areas near Whites Ferry. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:17 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.4 feet, or 3.6 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Mon Mon Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1PM 7PM 1AM Stg Time Date Potomac River Edwards Ferr 15.0 11.4 Mon 4 am 12.9 13.6 14.7 15.0 7am Tue &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1245 PM EST.
